title: Demon Vi is TERRIBLE
body:
How hard was it to do something like this?

What is this hot pink winged abomination we got instead?  There are times where directly ripping something off is way better than coming up with your own mess.  This was one of those times.

At least Officer Vi exists.

replies.body:
Hey guys! 

The model viewer generally doesn't give skins justice - I'd wait until you have a chance to see the skin in game. :]

So she's magically going to become completely different than what your art team came up with?

Nah.  Back to the drawing board.

It shouldn't take too long, the polycount guy has most of it done for you.

I didn't say she'd become completely different. However, the lighting looks much better in game, as well as any particles that are added to a skin. Our goal wasn't to copy this particular Polycount entry, which is why they aren't 100% copies of each other. 

I'm sorry you're not a fan of this particular skin. As always, constructive feedback regarding skins is always welcome!
Will she do an awesome Soar when she ults? maybe do some sort of Arial Spin or a little swoop Downward? Just curious, love the skins texture.
She does some pretty awesome stuff. :3 You'll see!

I think you're underestimating our tastes if you think our opinions will change if we see certain skins in game. 

I'm ok with the skin, but her face doesn't look like Vi imo.

What was the inspiration for this skin? Same question for Spirit Fire Brand.

> I think you're underestimating our tastes if you think our opinions will change if we see certain skins in game.

I'm not suggesting that opinions will automatically be swayed. Lighting, as well as particles, SFX, and voice processing make the skin ten times cooler than just taking a look at a model viewer. The whole package is what makes a skin cool, imo, not just the bits and pieces. 

> What was the inspiration for this skin? Same question for Spirit Fire Brand.

Honestly? We wanted to make a demonic Vi. There was a bit of inspiration from Hellboy. We got inspiration for Spirit Fire Brand from witch doctors.

So it looks like the color scheme Isn't getting an adjustment, so we aren't taking colorblindness into consideration anymore it seems

Hey XUnraveled,

We did take a look at this in terms of colorblind conditions. We had two Rioters who are colorblind take a look at this skin in game and determined that the colors in the particles were not an issue in terms of gameplay and were fairly clear in terms of differentiating it from the model. This is in regards to red/green colorblind, which is what we balance for, as it's the most common.  In some cases (Blood Moon Thresh v. base Thresh), we're unable to accommodate colorblind conditions fully, but it's part of our testing procedure.

If you never release a skin with voice processing again I will be glad. 

It tends to be used as an excuse to bump up the price of otherwise mediocre skins. I can understand it for certain skins (though the only one I can really think of is Arclight Varus, and that was removing voice processing, not adding it) but I don't feel that any of the other skins that have it really need it.

On a different note, there's an easy way to have people not freak out over model viewer stuff. You can either A) release in game screen shots in your PBE announcement threads or B) have some sort of way to preview skins in game, instead of having to rely on third party sites. This also prevents the 'splash looks nothing like the actual skin' problem.
